medical_history.chief_complaint: Recurrent sinusitis with progressive cough and bronchiectasis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced recurrent episodes of sinus congestion since her mid-20s, with 2-3 sinus infections annually. At age 30, she was evaluated for allergies, which were confirmed through skin and blood tests. Despite dietary restrictions, sinus congestion and infections recurred over the years. A persistent cough developed three years prior to the current evaluation, with daily production of yellowish-white sputum noted approximately six months before the visit, which occasionally appeared green. Chest radiography two months later showed bronchiectasis.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of recurrent sinusitis, bacterial pneumonia, allergic responses to multiple environmental and food allergens, migraines, tonsillectomy, uterine polypectomy, laser-assisted in situ keratomileusis, and removal of a benign breast mass.
medical_history.family_history: Father had prostate cancer, coronary artery disease, and a stroke; mother had coronary artery disease and underwent thyroidectomy for a benign nodule; brother had allergic rhinitis; sister is healthy.
medical_history.social_history: The patient has never smoked, does not drink alcohol or use illicit drugs, lives in Massachusetts, and works in an office. She enjoys gardening but has no known occupational or inhalational exposures. Her travel history includes trips to Canada and the Caribbean.
